javaEventing
Class EventManagerInstance

java.lang.Object
  javaEventing.EventManagerInstance

public class EventManagerInstance
extends java.lang.Object

This class should be used for subscribing to, and triggering events Copyright 2011 Espen Skjervold, FFI //

EventManagerInstance

Method Detail

registerEventListener

public void registerEventListener(GenericEventListener receiver,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass)
Registers an event listener, and binds it to a specific type of event. Define your own types of events by creating classes imlement the Event interface.

Parameters:
receiver - The callback object that will be called once the event is triggered. This may typically be an anonymous implementation of the class.
eventClass - The type of Event that is subscribed to. it may be another instance of the same Event type (the class inheriting the Event class).

registerEventListener

public void registerEventListener(java.lang.Object context,
                                  GenericEventListener receiver,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass)
Registers an event listener, and binds it to a specific type of event. Define your own types of events by creating classes imlement the Event interface.

Parameters:
context - Any type of object, which will serve as a context for your event listeners. Useful when bulk-unregistering event listeners. (usage: unregisterAllEventListenersForContext("myContext") ) Note: Context-matching is done using object.equals(object), not object references.
receiver - The callback object that will be called once the event is triggered. This may typically be an anonymous implementation of the class.
eventClass - The type of Event that is subscribed to. it may be another instance of the same Event type (the class inheriting the Event class).

unregisterAllEventSubscriptions

public void unregisterAllEventSubscriptions()

registerEventListener

public void registerEventListener(GenericEventListener receiver,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass,
                                  Condition condition)
Registers an event listener, and binds it to a specific type of event and provides a condition.

Parameters:
receiver - The callback object that will be called once the event is triggered. This may typically be an anonymous implementation of the class.
eventClass - The type of Event that is subscribed to.
condition - A condition that must be true for the EventListener to be called.

registerEventListener

public void registerEventListener(java.lang.Object context,
                                  GenericEventListener receiver,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass,
                                  Condition condition)
Registers an event listener, and binds it to a specific type of event and provides a condition.

Parameters:
context - Any type of object, which will serve as a context for your event listeners. Useful when bulk-unregistering event listeners. (usage: unregisterAllEventListenersForContext("myContext") ) Note: Context-matching is done using object.equals(object), not object references.
receiver - The callback object that will be called once the event is triggered. This may typically be an anonymous implementation of the class.
eventClass - The type of Event that is subscribed to.
condition - A condition that must be true for the EventListener to be called.

unregisterEventListener

public void unregisterEventListener(GenericEventListener receiver,
                                    java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass)
Unregisters an event listener bound to an event

Parameters:
receiver - The EventListener registered for a particular event.
event -

unregisterAllEventListenersForContext

public void unregisterAllEventListenersForContext(java.lang.Object context)
Unregisters all event listeners associated with a specific context (event listeners registered with EventManager.registerEventListener("someContext", myEventListener...) )

Parameters:
context - The object instance (or an object that .equals(object)==true) that was used to register the event listener.

waitUntilTriggered

public boolean waitUntilTriggered(java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass,
                                  long timeout)
A blocking call, freezing the current thread execution until the event is triggered. May be used for thread synchronization.

Parameters:
event - An instance of the type of Event that is subscribed to. This does not need to be the same Event instance that is used to trigger the event, it may be another instance of the same Event type (the class inheriting the Event class).
timeout - The number of milliseconds before the blocking call will resume regardless of whether the event was triggered or not. If zero, it will never time out.

waitUntilTriggered

public boolean waitUntilTriggered(java.lang.Class<? extends Event> eventClass,
                                  long timeout,
                                  Condition condition)
A blocking call, freezing the current thread execution until the event is triggered. May be used for thread synchronization.

Parameters:
event - An instance of the type of Event that is subscribed to. This does not need to be the same Event instance that is used to trigger the event, it may be another instance of the same Event type (the class inheriting the Event class).
timeout - The number of milliseconds before the blocking call will resume regardless of whether the event was triggered or not. If zero, it will never time out.
condition - A condition that must be true for the call to unblock.

triggerEvent

public void triggerEvent(java.lang.Object sender,
                         Event event)
Triggers an event.

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.

triggerEvent

public void triggerEvent(java.lang.Object sender,
                         Event event,
                         java.lang.Object conditionalExpression)
Triggers an event.

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.
conditionalExpression - An object of any type. Will be checked by any event listeners providing Condition-objects.

triggerFutureEvent

public void triggerFutureEvent(java.lang.Object sender,
                               Event event,
                               long delay,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
Triggers an event in the future. Notice that when there are events in the future, the EventManagerInstance is not able to shut down automatically before the event has been triggered. A manual shutdown can be initiated by calling EventManagerInstance.shutdown().

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.

triggerFutureEvent

public void triggerFutureEvent(java.lang.Object sender,
                               Event event,
                               java.lang.Object conditionalExpression,
                               long delay,
                               java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
Triggers an event in the future. Notice that when there are events in the future, the EventManagerInstance is not able to shut down automatically before the event has been triggered. A manual shutdown can be initiated by calling EventManagerInstance.shutdown().

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.
conditionalExpression - An object of any type. Will be checked by any event listeners providing Condition-objects.

triggerPeriodicEvent

                                 Event event,
                                 long initialDelay,
                                 long delay,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
Triggers an event in the future. Notice that when there are events in the future, the EventManagerInstance is not able to shut down automatically before the event has been triggered. A manual shutdown can be initiated by calling EventManagerInstance.shutdown().

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.

triggerPeriodicEvent

                                 Event event,
                                 java.lang.Object conditionalExpression,
                                 long initialDelay,
                                 long delay,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
Triggers an event in the future. Notice that when there are events in the future, the EventManagerInstance is not able to shut down automatically before the event has been triggered. A manual shutdown can be initiated by calling EventManagerInstance.shutdown().

Parameters:
sender - The object instance triggering the event.
event - An instance of the type of Event that is triggered.
conditionalExpression - An object of any type. Will be checked by any event listeners providing Condition-objects.

getEventExceptionHandler

public EventExceptionHandler getEventExceptionHandler()
Get current exception handler.

Returns:
current exception handler.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shutdown the event scheduler after the currently active event threads have exited. Qeued or scheduled events will not be executed.
